channel.title: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)
channel.description: ^^ sorry for flogging the forums, but i just have to know, cause i have a plan. ill explain everything if it can. btw, i did search detect modified client, and only got one result, so plz dont yell at me if i missed something.

item.title: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

awe i just relised u cant deob the client any more.

no, another effort wasted.

item.title: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)
item.dc:creator: @defyboy defyboy
item.description:
@defyboy wrote:

You cant really intercept the packets properly since the session key for the frame packet encryption is now sent in the RSA encrypted block.

item.title: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

You would not have to update the packet interceptor ever, you would however have to update the other client your talking about thats not connected to a server, your way would work and it would be undetectable, but its very hard to accomplish, and I think there would be easier ways...

Do you think when I finish my FindNPCCoord method Bentski can really make a bot with it?

Read full topic

item.title: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

you also have to remove all the traps each time you update, and there may be new ones. im more for not being banned, rather than having something simple that MAY or may not get banned.

Read full topic
item.source: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)

item.title: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)
item.dc:creator: @MrWicked MrWicked
item.description:
@MrWicked wrote:

I would agree with bentski, I dont cheat for rs2 anymore but Making an entirly different program/client to intercept and analyze the packets and respond correctly according to the results, seems a little overboard.

Also if the client updates itself again that will mean you must re-create your interceptor.

Read full topic
item.source: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)

Read full topic
item.source: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)

item.title: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

ok, now for my idea. i was under the impression that they could detect modified clients, but i wasnt quite sure.
theres three ways to cheat on runescape (in my mind anyway)

memory editing, very complicated (i was in the process of building a simple bot using memory reading bot, but stopped when i thought of this)
scar, can be resource intensive and never fool proof.
using a modified client - doesnt work any more ^^
or a hybrid method.

my idea is to capture the packets with a simple c++ program (i could probally make it in less than an hour, and if i knew what i was doing 10 minutes) which captures packets, and then copies them. one set of packets goes to the real client, the other set of packets goes to a heavily modifed client on a different port which purpose is only to unencrypt the packets and analyze them. the unmodified client will respond just as if it had recieved the packets normally. The modifed client wouldnt respond at all (and if it did it would go to the wrong port anyway), rather output the gained information into a program, such as SCAR prehaps. now you have a hybrid method of cheating. you also have all the information that scar cant give you, or without extensive scripts. eg. which shape is on that blasted box with the number 8.

what you think, workable?

Read full topic
item.source: A new use for modified clients (just an idea)
